author: Mark Jones
title: Christian Eriksen overtakes Dimitri Payet as the Premier League's most creative player
text:
Sport Christian Eriksen overtakes Dimitri Payet as the Premier League's most creative player With the Frenchman now back in his homeland, Tottenham's great Dane has taken over as the man who makes things happen in the Premier League Share Move over Dimitri, there's a new creator in town (Photo: Ian Walton) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
Dimitri Payet's move from West Ham to Marseille in January didn't just create a vacancy in the Hammers midfield, but at the top of the list of the most creative players in the Premier League too. 
The Frenchman was leading the way in term of chances created in the 2016/17 season before he moved back home in controversial circumstances, leaving a new, often overlooked man to inevitably take over at the top. 
And that finally happened on Sunday, when Tottenham's Christian Eriksen took his place at the top of the tree after creating four chances in Spurs' 3-2 win over Everton at White Hart Lane. Carefully calculating his next move (Photo: Andrew Powell) 
Data courtesy of EA SPORTS shows that that puts him at 78 chances created for the season, four more than Payet as he take his place at the top of the list. 
The full top 10 for the campaign looks like this: Chances created in the Premier League in 2016/17 
And not only that, Eriksen also has the joint-most assists in the Premier League this season. Always looking (Photo: Clive Mason) 
He's on 10 for the campaign, the same as Swansea's Gylfi Sigurdsson, marking him out as the best creative force in the division as Spurs battle for a place in the top four. 
The pair sit ahead of Manchester City's Kevin De Bruyne, Arsenal's Alexis Sanchez (both on 9) and West Brom's Matt Phillips (8). Most assists in the Premier League 2016/17 
The Dane managed 13 assists in the Premier League last season, the second most behind Arsenal's Mesut Ozil on 19. 
So that's Arsenal above Tottenham last season, and Spurs above Arsenal this... 
An omen?
